articles.headline: Hong Kong Protesters Storm Legislature, Dividing the Movement
articles.snippet: After weeks of protest that took the high road, a smaller group’s use of force to enter and deface government chambers raises questions about direction and leadership.
articles.abstract: After weeks of protest that took the high road, a smaller group’s use of force to enter and deface government chambers raises questions about direction and leadership.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Hundreds of thousands of demonstrators marched in peaceful protest on Monday as Hong Kong commemorated its  return to China in 1997, but the city was shaken by images of a smaller group of activists who broke into the legislature, smashed glass walls and spray-painted slogans in the inner chamber.

articles.headline: Trump Says Tanks Will Be on Display in Washington for July 4
articles.snippet: The tanks will join a spectacle of the nation’s firepower, including a flyover by Air Force One. Critics say Mr. Trump is hijacking a nonpartisan celebration.
articles.abstract: The tanks will join a spectacle of the nation’s firepower, including a flyover by Air Force One. Critics say Mr. Trump is hijacking a nonpartisan celebration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Monday that the Pentagon would put military tanks on display on Thursday in Washington as part of his plans to turn the annual Fourth of July celebration in the nation’s capital into a salute to the country’s military prowess.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Thomas Gibbons-Neff and John Ismay

articles.headline: Minority Women Are Winning the Jobs Race in a Record Economic Expansion
articles.snippet: The economic and social trends that have long kept Hispanic and black women from making job and wage gains appear to be shifting.
articles.abstract: The economic and social trends that have long kept Hispanic and black women from making job and wage gains appear to be shifting.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States economy on Monday hit a milestone, reaching its longest expansion on record. Just a decade ago, the nation was mired in a severe recession that had erased trillions of dollars in wealth and left millions of people out of work.

articles.headline: High in His ‘Glassle,’ Georgia’s Richest Man Looms Over Country’s Top Project
articles.snippet: A proposed deepwater port could recast the former Soviet republic’s image. But not without the backing of Bidzina Ivanishvili, a billionaire and power broker.
articles.abstract: A proposed deepwater port could recast the former Soviet republic’s image. But not without the backing of Bidzina Ivanishvili, a billionaire and power broker.
articles.lead_paragraph: TBILISI, Georgia — The republic of Georgia’s richest citizen, Bidzina Ivanishvili, is a born builder. He owns what is easily Tbilisi’s most eye-catching private structure, a futuristic, $50 million steel-and-glass castle, nicknamed “the glassle,” on a hill near the city’s historic neighborhood. It is a 107,000-square-foot personal office, complete with a helipad, a collection of modern art and a shark tank.

articles.headline: Li Keqiang, Chinese Premier, Reaches Out to Trump and Business
articles.snippet: Vague pledges from the country’s No. 2 leader suggest a willingness to appear conciliatory at a fraught time, and a need to reassure a worried Chinese public.
articles.abstract: Vague pledges from the country’s No. 2 leader suggest a willingness to appear conciliatory at a fraught time, and a need to reassure a worried Chinese public.
articles.lead_paragraph: DALIAN, China — A top Chinese leader made an unusually public effort on Tuesday to ease trade tensions somewhat with the United States, woo foreign investors and reassure his own country’s citizens that their economy remained on track.

articles.headline: Chobani Turns to Fair-Trade Program to Help Struggling Dairy Industry
articles.snippet: The yogurt company is teaming up with Fair Trade USA to create a label that would signal that the milk it used came from farms that treated workers and cows humanely.
articles.abstract: The yogurt company is teaming up with Fair Trade USA to create a label that would signal that the milk it used came from farms that treated workers and cows humanely.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fair-trade label was created decades ago to help artisans in developing nations. Now, there are fair-trade soccer balls, fair-trade soaps and fair-trade ice pops. Next up for the movement: the American dairy industry.

articles.headline: To Evade Sanctions on Iran, Ships Vanish in Plain Sight
articles.snippet: Empty tankers, arriving in the Strait of Hormuz, suddenly stop reporting their whereabouts. When they re-emerge on the grid, their tanks appear full.
articles.abstract: Empty tankers, arriving in the Strait of Hormuz, suddenly stop reporting their whereabouts. When they re-emerge on the grid, their tanks appear full.
articles.lead_paragraph: A week ago, a small tanker ship approached the Persian Gulf after a 19-day voyage from China. The captain, as required by international rules, reported the ship’s position, course, speed and another key detail: It was riding high in the water, meaning it was probably empty.
articles.byline: By Michael Forsythe and Ronen Bergman

articles.headline: Meet the Man Quietly Building the Tesla of Trucks, With Jeff Bezos Aboard
articles.snippet: R. J. Scaringe’s company, Rivian, has raised $1.7 billion from Amazon, Ford Motor and others without selling a single pickup truck and sport utility vehicle.
articles.abstract: R. J. Scaringe’s company, Rivian, has raised $1.7 billion from Amazon, Ford Motor and others without selling a single pickup truck and sport utility vehicle.
articles.lead_paragraph: NORMAL, Ill. — By definition, the time of the world’s richest man is pretty valuable. But early last fall, Jeff Bezos sought out a 36-year old entrepreneur named R.J. Scaringe and spent the better part of a day in Plymouth, Mich., at the company he founded, Rivian.

articles.headline: Trump and R.N.C. Raised $105 Million in 2nd Quarter, a Sign He Will Have Far More Money Than in 2016
articles.snippet: The figure reported by the president’s campaign and the Republican National Committee dwarfed President Barack Obama’s fund-raising during the same period in 2011.
articles.abstract: The figure reported by the president’s campaign and the Republican National Committee dwarfed President Barack Obama’s fund-raising during the same period in 2011.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s re-election campaign and the Republican National Committee said on Tuesday they had raised $105 million in the second quarter of this year, outraising President Barack Obama in the equivalent period during his 2012 re-election campaign and signaling that Mr. Trump will have far more resources than he did in 2016.
articles.byline: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Nike Drops ‘Betsy Ross Flag’ Sneaker After Kaepernick Criticizes It
articles.snippet: The decision to pull the shoes, which came after the Nike brand ambassador Colin Kaepernick objected to the design, ignited debate on social media.
articles.abstract: The decision to pull the shoes, which came after the Nike brand ambassador Colin Kaepernick objected to the design, ignited debate on social media.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nike planned to celebrate the Fourth of July with a new sneaker, a special edition of the Air Max 1 Quick Strike featuring that most patriotic of symbols: an American flag.
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu, Kevin Draper, Sandra E. Garcia and Niraj Chokshi

articles.headline: China Snares Tourists’ Phones in Surveillance Dragnet by Adding Secret App
articles.snippet: Border authorities routinely install the app on the phones of people entering the Xinjiang region by land from Central Asia, gathering personal data and scanning for material considered objectionable.
articles.abstract: Border authorities routinely install the app on the phones of people entering the Xinjiang region by land from Central Asia, gathering personal data and scanning for material considered objectionable.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China has turned its western region of Xinjiang into a police state with few modern parallels, employing a combination of high-tech surveillance and enormous manpower to monitor and subdue the area’s predominantly Muslim ethnic minorities.

articles.headline: Netflix Has a Talk Show Problem
articles.snippet: For sitcoms, dramas and reality shows, the jump to streaming was easy. But talk shows? It’s tricky.
articles.abstract: For sitcoms, dramas and reality shows, the jump to streaming was easy. But talk shows? It’s tricky.
articles.lead_paragraph: Netflix upended the entertainment business by successfully moving into nearly every genre — scripted dramas, comedies, stand-up specials, documentaries, reality shows and feature films. But one type of programming has proved tricky for the streaming giant: the talk show.
